intro: Cheiridopsis carinata, commonly known as the mountain ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and colorful, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, bead-like fruits that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cheiridopsis carinata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
